input.query: In terms of geographical distance between capital cities, which 2 countries are the furthest from each other within the ASEAN bloc according to wikipedia? Answer using a comma separated list, ordering the countries by alphabetical order.

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'To calculate the geographical distance between pairs of capital cities, I will use the Haversine formula, which calculates the distance between two points on the Earth based on their latitude and longitude. This calculation will be done for every combination of the capital cities of the ASEAN member countries. Here is the implementation of the plan: import math # Haversine function to calculate the distance between two points on the Earth def haversine(coord1, coord2): # Radius of the Earth in kilometers R = 6371.0 lat1, lon1 = coord1 lat2, lon2 = coord2 # Convert degrees to radians lat1 = math.radians(lat1) lon1 = math.radians(lon1) lat2 = math.radians(lat2) lon2 = math.radians(lon2) # Haversine formula dlon = lon2 - lon1 dlat = lat2 - lat1 a = math.sin(dlat/2)**2 + math.cos(lat1) * math.cos(lat2) * math.sin(dlon/2)**2 c = 2 * math.asin(math.sqrt(a)) # Distance in kilometers distance = R * c return distance # Calculate distances between each pair of capitals max_distance = 0 country_pair = ("", "") # To store the pair of countries with maximum distance countries = list(capital_coordinates.keys()) for i in range(len(countries)): for j in range(i + 1, len(countries)): country1 = countries[i] country2 = countries[j] distance = haversine(capital_coordinates[country1], capital_coordinates[country2]) if distance > max_distance: max_distance = distance country_pair = (country1, country2) # Sort the result alphabetically country_pair = sorted(country_pair) final_answer = ', '.join(country_pair) print(f"The countries with the furthest capitals are: {final_answer}") '}]

[{'type': 'text', 'text': 'Calling tools:\n[{\'id\': \'call_7\', \'type\': \'function\', \'function\': {\'name\': \'python_interpreter\', \'arguments\': \'import math\\n\\n# Haversine function to calculate the distance between two points on the Earth\\ndef haversine(coord1, coord2):\\n    # Radius of the Earth in kilometers\\n    R = 6371.0 \\n    lat1, lon1 = coord1\\n    lat2, lon2 = coord2\\n\\n    # Convert degrees to radians\\n    lat1 = math.radians(lat1)\\n    lon1 = math.radians(lon1)\\n    lat2 = math.radians(lat2)\\n    lon2 = math.radians(lon2)\\n\\n    # Haversine formula\\n    dlon = lon2 - lon1\\n    dlat = lat2 - lat1\\n    a = math.sin(dlat/2)**2 + math.cos(lat1) * math.cos(lat2) * math.sin(dlon/2)**2\\n    c = 2 * math.asin(math.sqrt(a))\\n    \\n    # Distance in kilometers\\n    distance = R * c\\n    return distance\\n\\n# Calculate distances between each pair of capitals\\nmax_distance = 0\\ncountry_pair = ("", "")  # To store the pair of countries with maximum distance\\n\\ncountries = list(capital_coordinates.keys())\\nfor i in range(len(countries)):\\n    for j in range(i + 1, len(countries)):\\n        country1 = countries[i]\\n        country2 = countries[j]\\n        distance = haversine(capital_coordinates[country1], capital_coordinates[country2])\\n        if distance > max_distance:\\n            max_distance = distance\\n            country_pair = (country1, country2)\\n\\n# Sort the result alphabetically\\ncountry_pair = sorted(country_pair)\\nfinal_answer = \\\', \\\'.join(country_pair)\\nprint(f"The countries with the furthest capitals are: {final_answer}")\'}}]'}]
